solution_line_template: On Saturday, he threw the ball {times_thrown_saturday} times, and since the temperature was 50 degrees, he could throw only {distance_50_deg} yards, totaling {times_thrown_saturday}*{distance_50_deg} = <<{times_thrown_saturday}*{distance_50_deg}={yards_saturday}>>{yards_saturday} yards.

On Sunday, the temperature favored him, and he threw the ball twice the distance he could throw on Saturday, which is {multiplier_twice}*{distance_50_deg} = <<{multiplier_twice}*{distance_50_deg}={distance_80_deg}>>{distance_80_deg} yards.
If he threw the ball {times_thrown_sunday} times, he threw for {times_thrown_sunday}*{distance_80_deg} = <<{times_thrown_sunday}*{distance_80_deg}={yards_sunday}>>{yards_sunday} yards.
In the two days, he threw {yards_sunday}+{yards_saturday} = <<{yards_sunday}+{yards_saturday}={total_yards}>>{total_yards} yards.
